section.title: Interface introduction

row.entry: Enable GSI Secure Message with specified message protection level.

entry.para: Values equal one of the following:

If value is set to Boolean.TRUE, the GSI Secure Message protected is not required in reply message. By default, if request was secured with GSI Secure Message, response is also required to have the same protection.
If value is set to Boolean.TRUE, only single certificae is used for the GSI Secure Message request. By default, the whole certificate chain is sent.
You can set the SOAP Actor of the signed message using the x509Actor property, but we do not recommend this unless you know what you are doing.

row.entry: Enable GSI Secure Conversation with specified message protection level.

entry.para: Values equal one of the following:

If value is set to Boolean.TRUE, the GSI Secure conversation protected is not required in reply message. By default, if request was secured with GSI Secure Conversation, response is also required to have the same protection.
You can set the SOAP Actor of the GSI signed/encrypted SOAP message by using the gssActor property. We recommend that you not do this unless you really know what you are doing.

row.entry: Allows for setting credentials for authentication. If not specified, the default user proxy is used. Please see the Security Library Compatibility Document for some hints on loading and managing different GSI credentials.

entry.para: Value equals the Instance of org.ietf.jgss.GSSCredential.
The credential can be specified either as: a) the path to a proxy file, or b) the path to a certificate and key file.
Example for option (b): <securityConfig xmlns="http://www.globus.org"> ... <credential> <key-file value="keyFile"/> <cert-file value="certFile"/> </credential> ... </securityConfig>

row.entry: Sets the GSI delegation mode. Used for GSI Secure Conversation only. If limited or full delegation is chosen, then some form of client side authorization needs to be done (i.e client side authorization cannot be set to none).
